stories.english: Naapi and The Rock
Naapi and his friend the Fox were traveling about one very warm day.
stories.pikani: Naapiwa kii otakkaayi Sinopaa ihta'pawaawahkaawa, ssksiksistoyi.
stories.phonics: NAA BEE WA - GEE OTUK GUY EE - SEE NOO BAA - EEH TAA BAA WAAH GAAYA, - SS KAG KSESS TOO YEE

stories.english: They stopped to rest on a large rock.
stories.phonics: EE TSET TOOT SEE GOO BEE WAA -UMM MEE YAA YEE – OOH GOO TOO GEE

stories.english: Naapi was very warm with his robe on.
stories.phonics: NAA BEE WA – SSKAA SAA KEN NSS SEE – AMEE – MAA EYEE -OO KSEN NAA TSEE WA

stories.english: Naapi pitied the rock and gave him his robe so the rock can be protected from the weather.
stories.pikani: Naapi atsikimmi ami oohkotoki kii ohkotsiwa ami maayi.
stories.phonics: NAA BEE WA – UTT TSEE KIM MEE – AMEE – OOH GOO TOO GEE – GEE – OO GOOT TSEE WAA- UMEE- MAA EYEE

stories.english: Naapi and the Fox continued on.
stories.phonics: NAA BEE WA – GEE – SEE NOO BAA WAA- MUTT TSEE TOO MAA TAA BOO YAA WAA

stories.english: Soon the rain began to fall on them.
stories.phonics: EE TOO MUTT TAAPS SOO TAA WA

stories.english: Naapi was getting cold and missed his robe. He told the Fox go back the rock and ask him if I could borrow my robe till the rain is over.
stories.pikani: Naapiwa itomattapi'niipitsiwa kii ikoo'kimiwa maayi. Anistssiiwa ami Sinopaawa, "Iisskoto'toosa naaiwa"
stories.phonics: NAA BEE WA – EE TOO MUTT TAA BEE KNEE PIT TSEE – GEE – EE GOO KIM ME WAA- MAA EYEE) (AA NESS TSEE WA – SEE NOO BAA WA – "IS SKOO TOO TOOS – NAA EE WA

stories.english: The Fox ran back to the rock.
stories.phonics: SEE NOO BAA WA -IT SSK KET BOO WAA – AMEE – OOH KOO TOO KEE

stories.english: Ask him that Naapiwa would like to borrow his robe.
stories.phonics: AA NESS TSEE WA YE – NAA BEE WA – AA KEP AH KOO MAA TSEE WA – MAA YEE

stories.english: The rock refused to give Naapi his robe back.
stories.phonics: KEE - OOH KOO TOO KEE – OO MAAT SSKO OOH KOO KAA TSA TSEK – MEE – MAA YEE

stories.english: Naapi got angry and went back to the rock,
stories.pikani: Naapi itoki'takiwa ki itsskitapoowa mi oohtotoki,
stories.phonics: NAA BEE WA – EE TOO KEY TAA KEY WA – GEE – ITT SSKE TAA BOO WA ME OOH KOO KEE

stories.english: "Give me my robe! You don't need a robe. He grabbed his robe off the rock.
stories.phonics: SS GOO KIT – NAA YEE – OO GAA SAA TSEE WA – MAA – YEE

stories.english: Then he and the Fox went on.
stories.phonics: GEE MAAT TSEE TOO MAT TAA BOO YE WAA

stories.english: Soon the ground began to rumble.
stories.phonics: MAA TSEE SUM MOO WA – KSAA KOM MA – AA WAA WAT OO BEE

stories.english: The rock was chasing them.
stories.phonics: AA MAA – OOH GOO TOO KAA – AA KAA KSEE SSAESS GOO YEE WAXS

stories.english: They began to run.
stories.phonics: GEE EE TOO TSIM MOO TAA YAA WA

stories.english: The Fox climbed in a hole.
stories.phonics: AAMA- SEE NOO BAA WA – SOO TAA MET SSAP OOH BAA WAA KNEE WA – MEE YAA YEE – AA WAA TSEE MAAN NA

stories.english: Naapi ran faster, but the rock was gaining on him.
stories.pikani: Naapiwa iiksskao'kska'siwa ki mi oohtotoki otaohtaitsiikkayi.
stories.phonics: NAA BEE WA – EEK SS KAOK SKA SEE WA – GEE MEE OOH KOO TOO KEE – OOT TAOH TSEK GAA YEE

stories.english: Soon, Naapiwa seen the common night hawks flying around.
stories.phonics: DAAM SSKOO KEE TSEN NOO YEE WA – UM MEET SEE - BIT TOO KSES – EE TAA BAA WAA WAA KNEE YEE WA

stories.english: "Oh, my brother's" yelled Naapi, "Help me"
stories.phonics: EE YOO – NESS GUN NEKSE – NOOH KSS BOOM MOO KEE KAA

stories.english: The common night hawk heard Naapi and came to his rescue.
stories.phonics: MEEK SEE BIT TOO KSEE – EE YOOH TOO YEE WA – NAA BEE WA - OUTSET SS BOOM MOO KAA KSE

stories.english: They swooped down on the rock and pecked at the rock.
stories.phonics: MEEK SEE BIT TOO KSES – EE TAAK KAA WAA TSEE YAA WA – AMEE – OOH KOO TOO KEE

stories.english: Finally, the rock broke into many pieces and was scattered all over.
stories.phonics: SOO TAAM OOH KAA NAA WAA NEET OOH PAAT TSEE TOO WAA WA – AMEE – OOH KOO TOO KA

stories.english: That is why today we see the remains of the rock scattered over the prairies.
stories.phonics: AA NOOHK – ITSE TAA BAA OH GOO SKEE AA WAA – OOH KOO TOO GA – SOOKA CUE WAAH TSEE

stories.english: The End!
Naapi and The Bullberries
Naapi was walking around. It was very hot.
He arrived at the shore of the river.
He sat down as he was looking into the water
He seen the bull berries
They were red
Naapi said, "If only I can eat some."
He undressed and he dove into the water
He was feeling around in the water
He was unable to find them
He was almost drowning
As he recovered. He was thinking
I will weigh myself down
He Picked Rocks
He Tied the rocks on his hands, his feet, and waist.
stories.pikani: Ayayissksipima O'tsístsi ki ohkátsistsi ki óópaihpi
stories.phonics: I-YA-YISK-SEE-BIM OO-TSEES-TS GEE OO-GUT-SEES-TS GEE OO-BAYH-BEE

stories.english: He dove into the water.
To where he seen the bull-berries
He could not find them and he was almost drowning
He crawled out of the water, he laid on his back. As he looked up…
There were the bull-berries, on the cliff
As he was going to pick some berries, he was pricked by the needles.
Naapi was mad. He grabbed a willow stick.
He was hitting the bull-berries with the willow stick.
He told them, "In the future, you will be thrashed to be picked."
And that is all.
